msDesc.head: Rámon Lull, Margarete Porete, pseudo-Augustine, (pseudo-) Jerome, (pseudo-) Seneca; A-C northern Italy, 15th century, second quarter and middle

physDesc.p: Three parts, together early, part A created as a supplement to part B by one of the scribes of part C. Early foliation, apparently by the same (fifteenth-century) hand which added the partial table of contents on fol. i(a) recto, probably the main scribe of A and C.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil: i-x (i is doubled), 1–110 (67–70 are omitted, fol. 73 four-foliated, fol. 93 doubled)
Earlier foliation in ink visible on some pages, some trimmed off.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639; rebacked.

history.origin: In the revised Quarto catalogue R. W. Hunt described this volume as 'written in Germany', presumably on palaeographical grounds. But on grounds of script, abbreviations and codicology an Italian origin for the whole volume seems more likely (as suggested by Römer (1971) p. 125). The script of fols. i-x and 95–105 is particularly marked by Italian features and spellings (such as 'x' for 's', 'concluxiones', 'glorioxus' etc.); Italian characteristics in fols. 1–94 include the abbreviations for 'qui', '-tur' and spellings such as 'sesaginta' (fol. 80vb).
history.provenance: This manuscript is perhaps to be associated with others acquired by Laud from Italy (apparently mostly from Venice) in 1637 (Quarto Catalogue, p. xxvii). 'E 89' on fol. ii recto is the former Laudian shelfmark.
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source:
Description by Tuija Ainonen and Matthew Holford (July 2020, rev. Sept. 2020). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue. H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885 [contents, acquisition]
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 21–2 Quarto Catalogue, col. 23 Quarto Catalogue, p. 538 (addenda)
Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2, part 1, p. 43

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project
JONAS: Répertoire des textes et des manuscrits médiévaux d'oc et d'oïl

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: F. Römer (ed.), 'A Late Medieval Collection of Epistles Ascribed to Saint Augustine', Augustinian Studies 2 (1971) 115–44; 3 (1972) 147–89.

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Laud Lat. 46 – Part A (fols. i(b)-x)

msItem.author: Ps.-Lentulus
msItem.title: De forma et statura nostri redemptoris
msItem.incipit: Quidam Lentulus romanus dum esset officialis in prouincia Iudee pro Romanis tempore
Apparuit temporibus istis et adhuc est homo
msItem.note: Added with a later cursive hand.
Preceded by a partial list of contents with earlier folio references, in a different hand.

msItem.rubric: Deus qui es sumus in omnibus bonis ad tuam laudem et honorem incipit disputatio heremite et Raymundi super aliquibus dubiis sententiarum magistri Petri Lombardi.
msItem.incipit: Utrum theologia scit scientia proprie
msItem.explicit: existens separata receperit. Deo gracias semper.

msItem.rubric: Notabilia uel summe siue conclusiones collecte in libro
msItem.incipit: Adam uicta prima temptatione adhuc potuiset vincere 81
msItem.explicit: Christus non habuit naturam generandi quia non assumpsit hominem 101. Deo gracias semper.

supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermark: Dreiburg, on a chainline, 23 25 , with 55mm. between chainlines; cf. Piccard XVI.i nos. 77–87 (Udine, etc., 1448–1463)
supportDesc.collation: 10+1 (one leaf, fol. i(b), added at the beginning)

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida by one scribe (the same as part C, fols. 95–102) with later additions on fol. i(b)r.

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain coloured initials in alternating red and blue, 2 lines; alternating red and blue paraphs.

history.origin: 15th century, middle (as part C) Italy, North

msItem.author: Rámon Lull
msItem.title: Quaestiones super Sententias
msItem.incipit: (fol. 1r) Raymundus Parisius studens statumque mundi huius perversum considerans
msItem.rubric: Questiones super primo libro sententiarum. Questio prima.
msItem.incipit: (fol. 1v)Questio prima. Utrum theologia sit scientia proprie. Solucio. Raymundus respondit dicens quod theologia est scientia duobus modis
msItem.explicit: in quorum custodia Raymundus hunc librum commendavit etc.
msItem.finalRubric: Finito libro sit laus et gloria Christo.

msItem.author: Margarete Porete
msItem.title: Le Mirouer des Simples Ames
msItem.rubric: In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sancti. Amen. Incipit liber qui appelatur speculum animarum simplicium et hec vocatur Margarita.
msItem.incipit: Anima tacta a Deo et a peccatis exuta
(fol. 72ra) describit. quia omnes alii usus
msItem.explicit: (fol. 72ra) fructum faciat centesimum in hiis qui audierint et digni erunt. Amen. Deo gratias.
msItem.note: Twenty-five leaves missing after fol. 66 according to the early foliation: the bulk of the text presumably excised due to its heterodox character. Fol. 71, misbound since the time of the early foliation, belongs after fol. 76 and is catalogued with item 8. Fol. 72ra contains the final sentences of the approbatio (c. 140) of Margarete's text.

msItem.author: Angela da Fulgineo
msItem.title: Liber
msItem.incipit: Si cum infra scripta contigerit legere uel uidere
In nomine sancte unitatis et indiuidue trinitatis patris et filii et spiritus sancti Amen. Iesu Christe fili dei uiui miserere nobis. Uere fidelium experiencia probat
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus de uita, doctrina et reuelationbus beate Angele de Fulgines
msItem.incipit: Uere fidelium experiencia probat

msItem.note: Items 5–12 derive from a collection of pseudo-Augustinian and other material assembled in Italy perhaps around 1300, discussed by F. Römer, 'A Late Medieval Collection of Epistles Ascribed to Saint Augustine', Augustinian Studies 2 (1971) 115–44; 3 (1972) 147–89; CPPM IIA. nos. 199–203. The full collection comprises 55 pseudo-Augustinian letters (CPPM IIA.203/1–55), two introductory letters (CPPM IIA.200/1–2), two appendices (CPPM IIA.201, 202) and seven additional letters (CPPM IIA.199/1–7).

msItem.rubric: Epistola beati Augustini ad Petrum dyaconum Utrum mali in inferno peccent
msItem.incipit: Dilecto filo Petro Augustinus episcopus salutem ... Utrum mali in inferno peccabunt

msItem.rubric: Epistula ad eundem de Lazari et diuitis uerbis
msItem.incipit: Quia fili prima questio

msItem.rubric: Idem ad Marcellum de potestate ligandi atque soluendi et dignitate sacerdotis
msItem.incipit: Illi namque in hac uita

msItem.rubric: Idem ad Bonifacium comittem de ueritate mendacio indicatio et adulatione
msItem.incipit: Bonifacio comitti uiro clarissomo Augustinus Yponensis episcopus salutem. Inter cetera que tibi pro nunc scribo

msItem.rubric: Idem ad idem de expellendo mortis timore
msItem.incipit: Uenerando merito quia collendo Bonifacio Augustinus Yponensis episcopus salutem. Arduam rem et difficilem

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Henodium utrum parabolice a Christo dicta fata fuerint uera
msItem.incipit: Diligendo fratri et quem in ueritate Henodio mihi carissimo Augustinus epsicopus salutem. Recepi litera tuas

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Epistola ad Leontinum (ep. 538)
msItem.rubric: Bernardi epistola ad Leontinum
msItem.incipit: Bernardus abbas Clare ualensis in epistola ad Leontinum sic ait: Heu, frater, quid est quod audio de te

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Ad Martialem de concubinis fugiendis (ep. supp. 65)
msItem.rubric: Epistola beati Jeronimi ad Martialem episcopum et apostatatum a uia salutis
msItem.incipit: Uita episcopi in omnibus irreprehensibilis esse debet

msItem.rubric: Epistola beati Augustini ad Cornelium philosophum ambitio Christu et superbum
msItem.incipit: Cornelio philosopho Augustinus dei seruus et ut bonus salutem. Ut nobis per tuas litteras amicabiles

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Neptarium
msItem.incipit: Domino eximio meritoque honorabilifratri Neptario frater Augustinus Aurelius Yponensis episcopus salutem in caritate non ficta. Recepi litteras tuas

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Maurilianum de auaritia
msItem.incipit: Nobili uiro et potenti Marsiliano Augustinus episcopus salutem eternam in Christo. Cum number multiplicata fuerit gloria
msItem.explicit: desidero te in christo ualere. Amen.

msItem.rubric: Augustinus epistola ad Nepotianum
msItem.incipit: Nepotiano dilecto Augustinus episcopus salutem. Licet sacerdos altissimi appelleris. Accepi litteras tuas in quibus dicis

msItem.rubric: Epistola Augustini ad Theophanum
msItem.incipit: Teophano diligendo Augustinus episcopus salutem. Licet sacerdos altissimi appelleris, licet etiam sapientia
msItem.explicit: non peccabis. Vale et ora pro nobis.

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Nembridum
msItem.incipit: Dilecto filio Nembrido. Legi tuas fraternas littras in quibus dicis uelle
msItem.note: Beginning of CPPM IIA.203/17, ed. Römer (1971), p. 141, text continues fol. 71ra.

msItem.incipit: collocatur. Hic ulteribus plenus sed post beatam spem consolatur
msItem.note: End of CPPM IIA.203/17 (misbound, continued from fol. 76v), ed. Römer (1971), pp. 141–42.

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Bonifacium militem de luxuria
msItem.incipit: Magnifico et illustri uiro Bonifacio Augustinus episcopus salutem. Legitur frequenter ut uere puto

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Cirillum de operibus piis
msItem.incipit: Amando filio quem diligo in ueritate Cirillo presbytero Augustinus episcopus Yponensis salutem et benedictionem. Querellam grandem de te auditam
msItem.explicit: affectu respueremus. Vale in christo iesu.

msItem.rubric: Augustinus epistola ad Fabianum
msItem.incipit: Dilecto in Christo Fabiano Augustinus episcopus salutem. Congratulor una tecum

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Brisinam de obedientia
msItem.incipit: Dilecta filia quam puro corde diligo in ueritate Brisina Augustinus episcopus salutem et benedictionem. Licet famula sis et serua aliorum

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Ualentinum de scientia
msItem.incipit: Ualentino nobili et magnifico uiro domino Augustinus salutem. Grandi desiderio et affectu nuper audiui
msItem.note: CPPM IIA.203/22, ed. Römer (1972), p. 149, text continues fol. 77ra.

msItem.incipit: querentes docere
msItem.explicit: folium arboris non mouetur. Vale et ora pro me.
msItem.note: CPPM IIA.203/22, ed. Römer (1972), p. 149, text continues from fol. 71vb.

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Paulinum
msItem.incipit: Si petis a me, Pauline frater, uturm Adam concupiuit

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Cantianum militem
msItem.incipit: Scripsisti nobis utrum delicate uestiri poetrat

msItem.rubric: Augusini epistola ad Selentianam
msItem.incipit: Si petis a me filia que sit uita melior

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Ad Madrigum Libellum de mulieribus effugiendis (ep. supp. 66)
msItem.rubric: De mulieribus fugiendis
msItem.incipit: Ieronimus ad Medrigum prebiterum. Tentamenta clericorum sunt feminarum frequenter accessus. Et quid tibi reuelat O clerice qui cotidie ad altare cum domino fabularis
msItem.explicit: Et sub eodem tecto cum eis nunquam dormias aut demores. Hec enim non solum doctrine seruorum Christi sed paganorum
msItem.note: Lambert 366; CPPM IIA.199/3 (=IIA.915); unpr.; begins as PL 30.288 (ep. supp. 42)

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Epistles
msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Aurelianum
msItem.incipit: Comes Aureliane magnifice. An ignoras quod deus

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome(?)
msItem.title: De divina sapientia
msItem.rubric: De diuina sapientia
msItem.incipit: Teodorus episcopus Tolletanus in epistola ad fratres sancti Rifini. Attendant et uigilanter aduertant
msItem.note: CPPM IIA.199/4; pr. GW 2596, ISTC ia01270000, sig. d i v - d ii v.

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Ualentinum
msItem.incipit: Si sapientia diuina repleri

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Lixarium prebyterum
msItem.incipit: Suspicaris ut asseris et dubitare

msItem.rubric: Epistola augustini ad Desiderium episcopum
msItem.incipit: Desiderio episcopo augustinus eternam in Christo salutem. An ignoras quod in hoc mundo

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Doroteum de presbyteris
msItem.incipit: Dilecto filio Dorotheo Augustinus episcopus salutem. Caue ne amore inebriatus

msItem.rubric: Augustinus ad Leontinam
msItem.incipit: Dilecta filia Leontina Augustinus episcopus salutem. Cum natura hominum satis prompta
msItem.explicit: Requiesce in pace et ora pro me

msItem.rubric: Apistola Augustinus ad Anastasium quomodo saluari potest in diuitiis
msItem.incipit: Dilecto et merito diligendo Anastasio Augustinus episcopus salutem. Si petis a me

msItem.rubric: Pars epistola Augustinus ad Cornelium de mercatoribus
msItem.incipit: Cupis lucrari, caue ne a uero recedas
msItem.note: Part of CPPM IIA.203/38, ed. Römer (1972), pp. 159–160.

msItem.rubric: (fol. 79vb) Augustinus ad Cornelium
msItem.incipit: Cornelio philosopho Augustinus episcopus salutem. Qualis et quanta sit nostra calamitas

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Epistula ad Eustochium de uirginitate seruanda
msItem.rubric: Epistola sancti Jeronimi ad Eustochium et legitur in festo sancti Jeronimi
msItem.incipit: Quia impossibile est in sensum hominis
msItem.note: Breaks off. Rest of fol. 80rb blank.

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Contra Jovinianum
msItem.incipit: Pauci admodum dies sunt
msItem.explicit: nullum sacerdotem bigamum nullum flaminem bimaritum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit post in nomine domine et beatissime Marie uirginis

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Epistula ad Pammachium et Oceanum de renuntiatione saeculi (ep. supp. 32)
msItem.rubric: Epistola sancti Jeronimi Pachomio et odcano
msItem.incipit: Qui Ethiopem inuitat ad balneas et si nigridinem non aufferat illi

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Epistula ad Oceanum de uita clericorum (ep. supp. 42)
msItem.rubric: Epistola sancti Jeronimi Occeano de uita clericorum
msItem.incipit: Sophromus Heusebius Jeronimus Occeano suo salutem. Deprecatus ut tibi breuiter exponerem

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Epistula ad Heliodorum exhortatoria (ep. 14)
msItem.rubric: Epistola sancti Jeronomi ad Heliodorum episcopum exortatoria de contemptu mundi
msItem.incipit: Quanto amore et studio
Bonus homo de bono thesauro ... Metiris nos uirtutibus tuis
msItem.explicit: in domino militantem parte saluari uolo. Amen.
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 93 blank; fol. 93(bis)r-94r blank.

msItem.author: Chrysostome
msItem.title: Ad Stagirium a daemone vexatum (CPG 4310)
msItem.incipit: Porro si nimius meror irruens eos
msItem.explicit: casibus frangi vel deici poteris. Deo gratias.
msItem.finalRubric: Hic est finis cuiusdam volumnis trium librorum Iohannis os auri scripti ad Stagirium monachum arrepetium
msItem.note: Added later in the same hand as item 1*. The final paragraphs of the text as pr. 1487 (ISTC ij00293000).

supportDesc.support: Parchment and paper mixed (the outer and middle bifolia of each quire (Italian?) parchment). Watermark: Dreiburg, on a chainline, 23 20 , with 48mm. between chainlines; type Piccard XVI.I.66–106, cf. esp. 73–6 (Ferrara, Urbino, Pessara, 1433–1436)
supportDesc.collation: 1–5(12) (fols. 1–60); 6(12–6)(the last six leaves of the quire cut out with loss of text) (fols. 61-'66–70'); [quires cut out]; 7(probably 12–2) (the first two leaves cut out; fol. 71 misbound and should follow fol. 76) (fols. 71–3, 73 'bis'-73 'quater', 75–77); 8(12) (fols. 78–89); 9(12–6) (the last six leaves cancelled) (fols. 90–93, 93bis, 94).Catchwords; leaf signatures (numbers only).

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 46 lines (fols. 70v-: 47 lines). Ruled horizontally in plummet (mostly erased but see e.g. fols. 52v-53r), vertically mostly in ink. Written above top line. Ruled space 195 143

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida with some humanistic forms; one scribe.

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain coloured initials in red and blue, mostly of 4 lines.

msItem.author: Ps.-Seneca
msItem.title: De remediis fortuitorum
msItem.rubric: Ad Gallionem de remediis fortuitorum
msItem.incipit: Hunc librum conposuit Seneca nobillimum oratorum
Licet et cunctorum poetarum carmina

msItem.author: Seneca
msItem.title: Epistola 88 de septem artibus liberalibus
msItem.incipit: De liberalibus studiis quid sentiam scire desiderans

msItem.title: Formula vitae honestae
msItem.rubric: Seneca de quatuor virtutibus principalibus
msItem.incipit: Quatuor uirtutum species multorum sapientum sentenciis

msItem.author: Seneca
msItem.title: Epistola 4
msItem.rubric: Seneca ad Lucilium epistola iiij incipit de contemnenda morte etc.
msItem.incipit: Perseuera ut cepisti et quam potes propria

msItem.title: Libellus fidei ad Innocentium papam
msItem.rubric: Expositio fidei sancti Ieronimi ad Alipium et Augustinum episcopos missa
msItem.incipit: Credimus Deum patrem omnipotentem cunctorum visibilium et inuisibilium conditorem. Credimus et in dominum nostrum yesum christum per quem creata sunt omnia. Verum dominum unigenitum et uerum dei filium non factam aut adoptiuum sed genitum
msItem.explicit: non catholicum non me hereticum conprobabit. Deo gracias semper.

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: De essentia divinitatis
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus sancti Hieronymi de essentia trinitatis vel deitatis et dictis de Deo translative vel de membris domini [in capitals]
msItem.incipit: Omnipotens Deus, pater et filius et spiritus sanctus, unus atque trinus

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Epistula ad Marcellam de decem nominibus Dei (ep. 25)
msItem.rubric: Hieronymus ad Marcellam de decem nominibus quibus apud Hebreos dicitur Deus
msItem.incipit: Nonagesimum psalmum legens in eo loco

supportDesc.support: Paper (one parchment leaf, fol. 105). Watermark: as part A.
supportDesc.collation: 1(10+1) (one leaf of parchment, fol. 105, added at the end) (fols. 95–104); followed by four leaves of blank paper (fols. 106–109), none watermarked.

layoutDesc.layout: Fols. 95ra-102ra: 2 cols., c. 44–7 lines. Written above top line. Ruled space 200 c. 140
Fols. 102rb-105ra: 2 cols., c. 38–9 lines. Written below top line. Ruled space 190–5 140–50

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida with some humanistic forms, probably two hands, (a) fols. 95ra-102ra, the hand of part A (b) fols. 102rb-105rb.

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain coloured initials in red and blue, varying from 6 to 2 lines.

revisionDesc.change: New draft description for Polonsky German.
